consume(uint256).details: Only callable by the rollup contractIn the first iteration we return empty tree root because first checkpoint's messages tree is always empty because there has to be a 1 checkpoint lag to prevent sequencer DOS attacks

returns._0: The root of the consumed tree

sendL2Message((bytes32,uint256),bytes32,.details: Emits `MessageSent` with data for easy access by the sequencer

params._content: - The content of the message (application specific)
params._secretHash: - The secret hash of the message (make it possible to hide when a specific message is consumed on L2)

returns._0: The key of the message in the set and its leaf index in the tree

consume(uint256).notice: Consumes the current tree, and starts a new one if needed

sendL2Message((bytes32,uint256),bytes32,.notice: Inserts a new message into the Inbox
